CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Languages.​Parsers.​Perl
CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Languages.​Language
public
CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Languages.​Parsers.​Perl

Additional language support for Perl.

Types
PODLineType
public enum PODLineType : byte
StartPOD

The first line of a POD comment which isn't in the Natural Docs or Javadoc format, such as "=pod".

StartNaturalDocs

The first line of a Natural Docs POD comment, such as "=begin natural docs".

StartJavadoc

The first line of a Javadoc POD comment, such as "=begin javadoc"

End

The end of the current POD comment.  Note that there can be multiple consecutive sections and there will be only one end line after all of them.  For example, "=begin naturaldocs ... =begin text ... =end".

Functions
Perl
public Perl (
Languages.Manager manager
)
GetPossibleDocumentationComments
override public List<PossibleDocumentationComment> GetPossibleDocumentationComments (
Tokenizer source
)

Goes through the file looking for comments that could possibly contain documentation and returns them as a list.  These comments are not guaranteed to have documentation in them, just to be acceptable candidates for them.  If there are no comments it will return an empty list.

All the comments in the returned list will have their comment symbols marked as CommentParsingType.CommentSymbol in the tokenizer.  This allows further operations to be done on them in a language independent manner.  If you want to also filter out text boxes and lines, use Comments.LineFinder.

Parsing Functions
TryToSkipPODLine
protected bool TryToSkipPODLine (
ref TokenIterator iterator,
out PODLineType type
)

If the iterator is on a POD line such as "=pod", moves the iterator past it and returns true and the type.  If the iterator isn't on a POD line it will return false and leave the iterator alone.
